channel.title: Contract Development on Phala Network Wiki
channel.description: Recent content in Contract Development on Phala Network Wiki

item.title: 1.1 Run a Local Development Network
item.description: Basic understanding of Linux shell and compiling is necessary to follow this tutorial. Overview In this tutorial, we are going to set up a "Hello World" development environment. We are going to deploy a full stack of the core blockchain and connect the Web UI to the blockchain. By the end of the tutorial, you will be able to: Send confidential transactions Get a ready-to-hack version of Phala Network for building your own confidential Dapps A full Phala Network stack has three components plus a Web UI.

item.title: 1.2 Hello World: your first confidential contract
item.description: Basic understanding of Rust language programming and smart contract development knowledge is necessary to follow this tutorial. Overview In this tutorial, we are going to continue on the development environment we have set up in the previous chapter, and explore how a confidential smart contract is made. By the end of this tutorial, you will: Learn how to develop a confidential contract Interact with the contract from the Web UI Build your own confidential contract For a high-level overview of Phala Network, please check the previous chapters.

item.title: 1.3 Troubleshooting
item.description: phala-blockchain Problem: "the wasm32-unknown-unknown target may not be installed" You need to add the wasm-unknown-unknown target to your rust toolchain. Do it by this (under the code repo): 1rustup target add wasm32-unknown-unknown Probelm: "consider giving accuracy a type" when building substrate error[E0282]: type annotations needed --> .../substrate/primitives/arithmetic/src/fixed_point.rs:541:9 | 541 | let accuracy = P::ACCURACY.saturated_into(); | ^^^^^^^^ consider giving `accuracy` a type ... 1604 | / implement_fixed!( 1605 | | FixedI128, 1606 | | test_fixed_i128, 1607 | | i128, .
